date.headline: graphisme.tk
date.text:
graphisme.tk was one of my first public website. The project was realised in collaboration with a web designer met on the Internet.

My task was to write the HTML and CSS using Photoshop files, as well as the PHP/MySQL allowing the website to run and be edited dynamically.

date.headline: My Mobile Site
date.text:
In 2008, Nokia developed a Mobile Web Server running on Symbian smartphones, exposing some of the phone's features to the web.

I wrote a facebook application allowing interaction with this software: viewing phone location, sending messages to the phone, displaying pictures on the phone...

date.headline: Le Polar
date.text:
Le Polar is a student organisation at UTC, offering services such as printing (from A4 to A0) as well as resale of computer accessories, stationery...

At Le Polar, I participated in migrating various software components to one centralized website: accounting, point of sale, inventory...

date.headline: UTCoupe
date.text:
UTCoupe is the team from UTC participating in the French Cup of Robotics.

At UTCoupe, I developed software and electronics for an autonomous robot entering the competition. I was also the team leader during two years.

In 2012, the team was ranked 18th out of 170.

date.headline: Hanzi Training
date.text:
This facebook game was designed during my 6-month stay in Shanghai. It helps practicing your Chinese characters by displaying you words and asking for their pinyin notation.

This game was also published for the BlackBerry Playbook tablet, under the name Chinese Characters.

date.headline: UTC Student Organisations homepage
date.text:
This homepage is used by more than 100 student organisations at UTC to communicate with all the students through articles or events.

This project uses the symfony framework and involved more than 10 developers. It has now been open-sourced on Github.

date.headline: Ticketing system
date.text:
Etuville sets up a party with more than 2800 participants every year.

During the 2011 edition, I was in charge of creating a new ticketing system, which allowed guests to buy their ticket online and print it from a generated PDF with a barcode. Tickets were then checked at the entrance of the event using a custom software.

date.headline: payutc
date.text:
payutc is an electronic payment system that has been setup for all the Student Organisations at UTC. It allows student to top-up their account online using their Credit Card and then use the money in organisations by presenting their RFID student card.

payutc uses a collection of Web Services and all components are standalone: server, top-up service, point of sales... The project is open-source and available on Github.

date.headline: SiMDE
date.text:
SiMDE is an organisation at UTC offering various IT services to other organisations. This includes web hosting, email, mailing lists or Active Directory.

I was a sysadmin at SiMDE and participated in building a new architecture using OpenVZ containers.
